extended_metaphor.metaphor: both Double Helix in DNA and Arc Reactor in Iron Man have Structural Redundancy
extended_metaphor.double_helix: Double Helix in DNA utilizes two intertwined spirals to increase stability and redundancy in storing genetic information.
extended_metaphor.arc_reactor: Similarly, the Arc Reactor in Iron Man design includes redundant energy storage mechanisms to ensure stable and consistent power output, reflecting the same principle of enhancing reliability through duplication.

extended_metaphor.metaphor: both Double Helix in DNA and Arc Reactor in Iron Man have Efficient Use of Space
extended_metaphor.double_helix: Double Helix in DNA features a compact geometric configuration that allows for high data density and efficient storage of genetic information.
extended_metaphor.arc_reactor: Likewise, the Arc Reactor in Iron Man utilizes a space-efficient design to store and regulate energy, maximizing the power output in a confined space, akin to the data density achieved by the Double Helix.

extended_metaphor.metaphor: both Double Helix in DNA and Arc Reactor in Iron Man have Modularity
extended_metaphor.double_helix: Double Helix in DNA encodes genetic information along the length of the strands, enabling easy separation during replication or protein synthesis.
extended_metaphor.arc_reactor: Correspondingly, the Arc Reactor in Iron Man employs modular components that can be easily assembled or disassembled, allowing for efficient maintenance and customization, resembling the versatility provided by the modularity of the Double Helix structure in DNA.
